commit_message:
Delete secret key on image deletion

We add two extra properties for images:
- cinder_encryption_key_id, which stores the encryption key id;
- cinder_encryption_key_deletion_policy, which states whether the secret
  key should be deleted on image deletion.

This feature uses the Castellan key manager, and will therefore work
with all its supported backends.

Implements: blueprint barbican-secret-deletion-support
DocImpact

Change-Id: Iacd0b3785ad4cdd06961e6d11967775806e009ff

commit_message:
Mark HPE Lefthand Driver Unsupported

The HPE Lefthand driver has failed to demonstrate Pyton3.7
support as was required during the Train release.  As
a result the driver is being marked unsupported and will
be removed in the 'U' release if support is not
demonstrated via 3rd Party CI.

Change-Id: Ib495dc5931f8011cbc8b7527dec419d143fca1d5

commit_message:
k8s: fix flannel network configuration

Flannel has been broken since it was moved to self hosted.  The
iptables rules necessary to be there were removed in that commit
and therefore it was always failing to provision any flannel
clusters.

Change-Id: I5d8ef0ed187a6af854d1412f8dad5d634750655e

commit_message:
openstack-macros: Use py3 in %openstack_test_package_install

We want to switch all packages to python3, so the macro for the test
package installation needs to link into python3.

Change-Id: Ia2086ad040a96b86e46d8435346875adecac8e3a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-03 14:34:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Improve workflow notifications and webhook data

The task_execution_id is required to be able to restore the hierarchy
of tasks and workflows on the notification receiver side. Also, including

ini files.

Change-Id: I714fd5c32b0f31f85ac5a4d22d161e662bf18687
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-09-04 05:20:33.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/notifiers/default_notifier.py', 'mistral/engine/workflows.py', 'doc/source/configuration/config-guide.rst'], 'message': 'Improve workflow notifications and webhook data

The task_execution_id is required to be able to restore the hierarchy
of tasks and workflows on the notification receiver side. Also, including
the event in the notification is very useful.

Change-Id: I714fd5c32b0f31f85ac5a4d22d161e662bf18687

commit_message:
Improve workflow notifications and webhook data

The task_execution_id is required to be able to restore the hierarchy
of tasks and workflows on the notification receiver side. Also, including
the event in the notification is very useful.

Also fix the documentation as multiline strings are not supported in
ini files.

Change-Id: I714fd5c32b0f31f85ac5a4d22d161e662bf18687

subject: metal: add docs + start using no_containers
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-19 21:15:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'metal: add docs + start using no_containers

We have a feature that allows us to stop using containers for
a specific host inside the openstack_user_config directly.

This patch starts making the metal jobs to use it instead of
using an env.d override which should make the upgrade jobs much
cleaner.

commit_message:
metal: add docs + start using no_containers

We have a feature that allows us to stop using containers for
a specific host inside the openstack_user_config directly.

This patch starts making the metal jobs to use it instead of
using an env.d override which should make the upgrade jobs much
cleaner.

Change-Id: I1b2116b86d1e4d68867111068aaf2d32e7f3a731

commit_message:
Fix sensitivity to the initial device driver

Previously it was expected that all devices are initially
binded on kernel driver. In case of userspace driver it
caused an incorrect behavior.

This patch makes sriov binding driver insensitive for
initial device driver.

Change-Id: I1be19aceb9176d1bdf7f0f712a4a02ec2cd3ce8d
Closes-Bug: 1842446
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>

commit_message:
add metadef vlaues for new video models

- This change adds the newly supported libvirt
  video models, virtio, gop and none.
- This change updates the train metadefs changes
  release note.

Change-Id: I440a038b53825b5f92fc977566edcf3cabfba673

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: I83f264f58543ae90a941afd37567eeb46b4acfcc

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-04 07:30:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Send global_request_id for tracing calls

This patch adds the global_request_id to the constructor for nova client,
keystone client, neutron client and placement client which will pass the
global_request_id into these respective services on all API calls.
Supporting global_request_id makes debugging easier when request touches
many services in cloud. The blazar global_request-id will be sent to
these services in the request header like below and it will be available
with context.global_request_id:

  -H "X-OpenStack-Request-ID: req-1a9b7b24-02ed-4400-bcc3-cc1bcbb59147"

Sample log output of neutron service for ``POST v1/floatingips`` API
which logs global request ID `req-e19f8f4f-40e7-441e-b776-7b43ed15c7dd`
is shown below.
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/753807

Oslo spec I65de8261746b25d45e105394f4eeb95b9cb3bd42
Change-Id: I5bb3631c4fb178293ee8eefbe1aa8b819a196a9f

commit_message:
Send global_request_id for tracing calls

This patch adds global_request_id to the constructor for nova client,
keystone client, neutron client and placement client which will pass the
global_request_id to these respective services on all API calls.
Supporting global_request_id makes debugging easier when requests reach
many different OpenStack services. The blazar global_request_id will be
sent to these services in the request header like below and it will be
available with context.global_request_id:

  -H "X-OpenStack-Request-ID: req-1a9b7b24-02ed-4400-bcc3-cc1bcbb59147"

Sample log output of neutron service for ``POST v1/floatingips`` API
which logs global request ID `req-e19f8f4f-40e7-441e-b776-7b43ed15c7dd`
is shown at: http://paste.openstack.org/show/753807

Oslo spec I65de8261746b25d45e105394f4eeb95b9cb3bd42
Change-Id: I5bb3631c4fb178293ee8eefbe1aa8b819a196a9f

commit_message:
ML2 plugin: extract and postpone limit in port query

as with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656066/ if limit is applied in
any place other than at the end of the filters, sql alchemy will return
an error, and possibily we could return less result than intended.

Change-Id: I9a54ae99d2d5dfda63cb0061bcf3d727ed7cc992
Closes-Bug: #1827363

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: I5f2caba62595946f8ade6db22a1aba080b927fc8

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iddd52c58c0ce33dc39e5746a0dfce2f900cea6b6

subject: Ensure conflicts creating subnet from subnetpools are retried
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-04 09:07:12.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/namespace_subnet.py'], 'message': 'Ensure conflicts creating subnet from subnetpools are retried

If a lot of subnets are created at once, there is a chance that
Neutron will get the calls concurrently and fail. Internally Neutron
will retry but it may happen that the limit in the number of retries
is also hit. Thus this patch ensures that scenario is catched and
reacted to.

Change-Id: I83d62616835f22e916bfe056e793eb31654be51f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Ensure conflicts creating subnet from subnetpools are retried

If a lot of subnets are created at once, there is a chance that
Neutron will get the calls concurrently and fail. Internally Neutron
will retry but it may happen that the limit in the number of retries
is also hit. Thus this patch ensures that scenario is catched and
reacted to.

Change-Id: I83d62616835f22e916bfe056e793eb31654be51f

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: Iebca5c4cc8dfdecf7c561b3612691b62ca4ac0c8

commit_message:
opensuse: use proper nodeset

Also convert to the right set of packages and sort
the list alphabetically: High level changes are:

- switch to python 3.x
- switch to mkisofs, genisoimage was dropped

Change-Id: I17d36a2d36c941c5b5e3b5a40e42315caf275da4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-09 12:35:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: Bump up fluentd

Change-Id: I40a81103317ac044d9311b2505593056cf313bd2
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-08-09 17:04:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Change fluentd to td-agent on CentOS

Fluentd packages in CentOS Opstools SIG repos is very old,
because of old-ish ruby (2.0) packaged with CentOS 7.

On the other hand - TreasureData packages for fluentd are packaged
with embedded ruby as dependencies - so this change moves to those.
Thanks to that we are able to move from fluentd 0.12 to 1.4.2.

Still we need ruby-devel, because we download monasca output plugin
as source and build them during installation.

Fluentd/TD-Agent per arch/distro status after this change:
x86_64:
  centos: package from td-agent repo, with ruby embedded and
          elasticsearch plugin embedded
  ubuntu/debian: td-agent repo, with ruby embedded and
                 elasticsearch plugin embedded
arm:
  centos: CentOS opstools repo with backlevel ruby and old fluentd,
          plugins packaged as rpms
  ubuntu/debian: fluentd & plugins installed using gem

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676131

', 'number': 29}, {'created': '2019-08-26 07:45:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Change fluentd to td-agent on CentOS

Fluentd packages in CentOS Opstools SIG repos is very old,
because of old-ish ruby (2.0) packaged with CentOS 7.

On the other hand - TreasureData packages for fluentd are packaged
with embedded ruby as dependencies - so this change moves to those.
Thanks to that we are able to move from fluentd 0.12 to 1.4.2.

Still we need ruby-devel, because we download monasca output plugin
as source and build them during installation.

Fluentd/TD-Agent per arch/distro status after this change:
x86_64:
  centos: package from td-agent repo, with ruby embedded and
          elasticsearch plugin embedded
  ubuntu/debian: td-agent repo, with ruby embedded and
                 elasticsearch plugin embedded
arm:
  centos: CentOS opstools repo with backlevel ruby and old fluentd,
          plugins packaged as rpms
  ubuntu/debian: fluentd & plugins installed using gem

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676447

commit_message:
Change fluentd to td-agent on CentOS

Fluentd packages in CentOS Opstools SIG repos is very old,
because of old-ish ruby (2.0) packaged with CentOS 7.

On the other hand - TreasureData packages for fluentd are packaged
with embedded ruby as dependencies - so this change moves to those.
Thanks to that we are able to move from fluentd 0.12 to 1.4.2.

Still we need ruby-devel for non-td-agent distros,
because we download monasca output plugin as source and build it
during installation.

* Bump up td.repo to version 3
* Merge sudoers into one file
* Change fluentd plugin install macro to reflect changes

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/679209/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/679885/
Change-Id: I40a81103317ac044d9311b2505593056cf313bd2

subject: Do not delete cracklib from /usr/share
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17799, 'name': 'Logan V', 'email': 'logan2211@gmail.com', 'username': 'Logan2211'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 16:30:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Stop deleting random things from /usr/share

We have an application breaking because /usr/share/cracklib is being
deleted from wiped out from the image. The application installs its
dependencies, including cracklib, but since yum shows that cracklib
is already installed, it does not reinstall it. But since random files
are being deleted, things are broken.

I think this is an attempt at image minimization, which is a
reasonable goal, but such aggressive attempts at minimization should
be undertaken in a separate element, or done more cleanly (maybe
by uninstalling the package if possible, or other means.)

Change-Id: Id6fccf76c706dbc6c2124abcfd12c1f10cef5e09

deleted from the image. The application installs its dependencies,
including cracklib, but since yum shows that cracklib is already
installed, it does not reinstall it. But since random files are being

I think this is an attempt at image minimization, which is a
reasonable goal, but such aggressive attempts at minimization should
be undertaken in a separate element, or done more cleanly (maybe
by uninstalling the package if possible, or other means.)

Change-Id: Id6fccf76c706dbc6c2124abcfd12c1f10cef5e09

commit_message:
Do not delete cracklib from /usr/share

We have an application breaking because /usr/share/cracklib is being
deleted from the image. The application installs its dependencies,
including cracklib, but since yum shows that cracklib is already
installed, it does not reinstall it.

Change-Id: Id6fccf76c706dbc6c2124abcfd12c1f10cef5e09

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: If5446ce4ceee7e38a0052503aa8fc2b6c5d7de66

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: Ib7379bb5066ede1956424dc92cf302ec22053f21

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3d1a821a952fa8658372195d8737e0cce97b24e9

commit_message:
Create placement client for each request

In plugin files to talk to placement, we created one client and reused
it, but it turned out that to support global-request-id we'd like to
prepare fresh client with current context.

Therefore this patch prepares for it using fresh client in all API
methods of get, post, put and delete.

Change-Id: Iaa66019d6bc376d07f4f4a703f3dcfc6619eb358
Partially-Implements: blueprint oslo-middleware-request-id

commit_message:
Move descriptions of openstack_auth settings

This commit moves descriptions of settings defined in openstack_auth
from openstack_dashboard/settings.py and local_settings.py
to openstack_auth/settings.py.

When openstack_dashboard has different default settings
from openstack_auth defaults, they are now moved to
openstack_dashboard/defaults.py.

Part of blueprint ini-based-configuration
Change-Id: Ie201c78ddb26bdfcbc6f54c62be2561e4834e3d6

commit_message:
Fixed use of flake8

Flake8 was wrongly listed as a runtime dependency. That mistake messed
system flake8 version. Flake8 is a test requirement not a runtime one.

Also flake8 version is already determined by hacking version, so we
update it to recent version.

Change-Id: Iccd9dc6f2508127f17712d16dfce6538ff83807e

commit_message:
Allow configurable gzip binary name

Add a new environment variable $DIB_GZIP_BIN allowing builders to
specify a different gzip (such as pigz) to be used when compressing
tgz images.

Change-Id: Ifb617568140a149e2fda241e07ff8a59429e6697

Create firewall by heat with template file unsuccessfully due to
"INACTIVE".But I can create firewall successfully In the state of
INACTIVE via the rest api of neutron. And the status INACTIVE to
firewall is that the firewall is not applied to a router.And it
can still work in INACTIVE status. So we can judge the firewall
is created successfully in inactive state.

commit_message:
Firewall creation failed due to "INACTIVE"

Create firewall by heat with template file unsuccessfully due to
"INACTIVE".But I can create firewall successfully In the state of
INACTIVE via the rest api of neutron. And the status INACTIVE to
firewall is that the firewall is not applied to a router.And it
can still work in INACTIVE status. So we can judge the firewall
is created successfully in inactive state.

Change-Id: I6c329808b1a0b27a5a6e834de41fa9944739b9a0
Story: #2006351
Task: #36117

subject: Remove runtime.LockOSThread() call from kuryr-cni
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 13:04:25.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_cni/main.go'], 'message': "Remove runtime.LockOSThread() call from kuryr-cni

runtime.LockOSThread() was a leftover from initial CNI plugin skeleton.
It is only required when CNI plugin does the netns operations. Our
plugin isn't doing that as it's kuryr-daemon that is responsible for
that.

Also the imports are now in nicer order.

Change-Id: I1d7ee6a8fec104fd09094a49304a4c22b419cf3a
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove runtime.LockOSThread() call from kuryr-cni

runtime.LockOSThread() was a leftover from initial CNI plugin skeleton.
It is only required when CNI plugin does the netns operations. Our
plugin isn't doing that as it's kuryr-daemon that is responsible for
that.

Also the imports are now in nicer order.

Change-Id: I1d7ee6a8fec104fd09094a49304a4c22b419cf3a

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If5baea647e6a31158b87b070d56e529d29370a94

subject: Use shutil.move rather than os.rename
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-05 19:17:13.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/rabbit_utils.py'], 'message': 'Use shutil.move rather than os.rename

When the source and destination file paths are not on the same partition
os.rename raises OSError: [Errno 18] Invalid cross-device link.

Use shutil.move instead.

Change-Id: I28d6cb6c15a4496243fab7ec6c7eedcd1422f4c2
Closes-Bug: #1833804
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use shutil.move rather than os.rename

When the source and destination file paths are not on the same partition
os.rename raises OSError: [Errno 18] Invalid cross-device link.

Use shutil.move instead.

Change-Id: I28d6cb6c15a4496243fab7ec6c7eedcd1422f4c2
Closes-Bug: #1833804

restore from git history.

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I5845b56352e5e253c847a3829e60d57ef60b0289
Sem-Ver: feature

subject: Add request_id middleware support
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-15 07:30:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add request_id middleware support

'x-openstack-request-id' is the common header name for request ID
which is implemented in most of the OpenStack services. Using the
oslo middleware `request_id` middleware is a convenient way to
generate request ID and also include it in the response.

The request ID will be generated by the oslo middleware and is
inserted into the request environment. On the response end, the
middleware is again used, this time to attach the
'x-openstack-request-id' header, using the value of the generated
request ID.

Note: For v2 apis, the request_id is not returned in response header
but it will be logged in logs.

APIImpact:
responses of the API will include 'x-openstack-request-id' header.

Implements: blueprint oslo-middleware-request-id

Change-Id: I437f783787514ff1add2d7f0059cb27addd12c3e

commit_message:
Add request_id middleware support

'x-openstack-request-id' is the common header name for request ID
which is implemented in most of the OpenStack services. Using the
oslo middleware `request_id` middleware is a convenient way to
generate request ID and also include it in the response.

The request ID will be generated by the oslo middleware and is
inserted into the request environment. On the response end, the
middleware is again used, this time to attach the
'x-openstack-request-id' header, using the value of the generated
request ID.

Sample log output of blazar-api service for ``GET v1/os-hosts`` API
which logs local request ID `req-de45521c-2a04-4e7d-809a-960e782eb1e7`
is shown below:
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/753805/

Note: For v2 apis, the request_id is not returned in response header
but it will be logged in logs.

APIImpact:
responses of the API will include 'x-openstack-request-id' header.

Implements: blueprint oslo-middleware-request-id
Change-Id: I437f783787514ff1add2d7f0059cb27addd12c3e

commit_message:
Update for Storyboard

This project uses storyboard for new bugs, so fix a few places:

* Fix the "Report a bug" links so that bugs get reported against
  storyboard, not launchpad.
* Update CONTRIBUTING to link to storyboard.

Change-Id: I2760db2e14015407af46ec52ffe4883262ccb5ba

commit_message:
tempest: Cleanup & fixes

- Add a systemd tmpfile to create /run/tempest which can be used
  during testruns
- Split python3-tempest subpackage to have the python module in an
  extra package (similar to other openstack services)
- generate and install /etc/tempest/tempest.conf . It's always useful
  to have a sample config file available
- create /var/lib/openstack-tempest-test on (open)SUSE systems to be
  compatible with older tempest packages from SUSE
- Add Provides/Obsoletes for openstack-tempest-test package
  on (open)SUSE to be compatible with older tempest packages

Change-Id: Ib791fa19cac43fe2a72bd86d599d6a6343ec50b6

commit_message:
Rename openSUSE 15.1 testing to 15

This is consistent with the previous simplication of
build targets in the opendev environment to refer to
"opensuse15" being the alias of "latest stable openSUSE Leap 15.x".

Change-Id: I904a3ca0d6dbddd2bb1a673836ab6a0ad249526d

commit_message:
New command "openstack overcloud node unprovision"

This is a companion command to "openstack overcloud node provision"
which is required for scale-down and should be run after "openstack
overcloud deploy".

It will undeploy any instance which has provisioned=False in the
supplied roles yaml, see this change[1] for the provisioned format.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672605/

Change-Id: Ic7705c290220df7c55656fa080ff74315fb2030f
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672848/

commit_message:
Add multistack support to tripleo-ansible-inventory

If tripleo-ansible-inventory is called with '--stack foo,bar',
then build an inventory for stack foo and stack bar; then
merge the two inventories into one before writing it out to
an inventory file.

An ansible inventory host group will be created for every
item in the cross product of stacks and roles. For example,
central_Controller, edge0_Compute, edge1_Compute, etc.

Change-Id: I23fdeaa4950244bf3aec8e8ea71e8a29f763c074
Depends-On: I522f1acbd39ad36ae1fec896188d3e20e0575566
Implements: blueprint split-control-plane-unified-inventory

This change will add an empty block for `fluentd_monasca_plugin_install` to
ensure there are no plugins installed. In a proposed change in kolla, a new
block is being added specifically for the monasca plugins, which is causing
our container build process to fail in their external CI. By blocking this
out we'll maintain our expected stance of not installing any plugins.

Change-Id: Ic7f2d12073883bce4e03a48ff6a2515acf6298bf
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/675614
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add empty block for "fluentd_monasca_plugin_install"

This change will add an empty block for `fluentd_monasca_plugin_install` to
ensure there are no plugins installed. In a proposed change in kolla, a new
block is being added specifically for the monasca plugins, which is causing
our container build process to fail in their external CI. By blocking this
out we'll maintain our expected stance of not installing any plugins.

Change-Id: Ic7f2d12073883bce4e03a48ff6a2515acf6298bf
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/675614
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
config-download: rename pre/post deployment hostvars

We can't have numbers starting an Ansible var, so we need to rename the
pre/post deployments host vars, or we hit this error:
  template error while templating string: expected token 'end of print statement'

https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_variables.html#creating-valid-variable-names

In this patch we have to duplicate host vars but it'll be cleaned up
once we change to the new file in THT.

Change-Id: Idbdd6a21eb2cd488daa1e3ddc844b4fc5267047c
Related-Bug: #1842141

commit_message:
Use undercloud-connection to local for running validations with the CLI

This patch adds the **undercloud_connection** (set to 'ssh' by default)
parameter to the get_tripleo_ansible_inventory() function which allow
the CLI to create a static inventory file with local connection for the
undercloud.

Change-Id: I50d486afe2a11e830c72145154dc2b0764aece07
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5075a76366db0923f12fd515144078658fdd9a77)

commit_message:
Make periodic job run with check parameters

In tripleo-ci we mix periodic jobs with promotion jobs.
This patch makes periodic jobs to run periodically, but with
settings of regular "check" job (instead of "promotion" job)
Change-Id: I534c47b62ae6aa316ec1dc19bec878924143e015

commit_message:
PDF Documentation Build tox target

This patch adds a `pdf-docs` tox target that will build
PDF versions of our docs. As per the Train community goal:

  https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/train/pdf-doc-generation.html

This repo was not setup for building docs at all, so:
* enables the docs job and fixes tox.ini for it.
* add doc/requirements.txt and use in tox.ini
* update doc/source/conf.py for using openstackdocstheme

Note that the documents are just skeletons, so we do not publish the
docs yet, just build them.

Also, cleans up .zuul.yaml and uses templates where possible instead of
individual jobs.

Story: 2006122
Task: 35513
Change-Id: I89db230c31464a89a82aa72b86348f51b61990ca

commit_message:
Introduce TripleoInventories object

This object can be constructed by passing it
a mapping of stack name to TripleoInventory
objects.

It has a merge method which merges all of the
TripleoInventory objects into one OrderedDict
which appends the stack name and an underscore
to each host group to avoid name collisions.

It has a write_static_inventory method which
writes the merged OrderedDict into an Ansible
inventory.

Change-Id: I522f1acbd39ad36ae1fec896188d3e20e0575566
Implements: blueprint split-control-plane-unified-inventory

Change-Id: I446697c9073a43cdc609bba47357a3bd960ef56d
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix OVS build issue on Fedora

No longer build the OVS kernel modules when installing from
source. This was added when OVS didn't support conntrack,
which hasn't been the case for a while.

Change-Id: I446697c9073a43cdc609bba47357a3bd960ef56d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 12:43:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Google Cloud Storage connection failure: 'bytes' object has no attribute 'encode'

Correcting encode() and decode() methods of 8-bit and Unicode string objects.

In Python 2, Both 8-bit and Unicode strings had both methods and the type of the return value was based on the specific encoding passed in.

In Python 3, Text strings only have an encode() method, and that method can only be used with codecs that produce bytes objects. Similarly bytes and bytearray objects only have a decode() method which can only be used with codecs that produce string objects.

Change-Id: I214a786858655b8caf9612f3da5403c7d0bb7387
Closes-Bug: #1831735
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-09-04 21:58:08.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/backup/drivers/gcs.py'], 'message': 'Google backup: correct string encoding between py 2 and 3

Correcting encode() and decode() methods of 8-bit and Unicode
string objects.

In Python 2, Both 8-bit and Unicode strings had both methods
and the type of the return value was based on the specific
encoding passed in.

In Python 3, Text strings only have an encode() method, and
that method can only be used with codecs that produce bytes
objects. Similarly bytes and bytearray objects only have a
decode() method which can only be used with codecs that
produce string objects.

Change-Id: I214a786858655b8caf9612f3da5403c7d0bb7387
Closes-Bug: #1831735
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Google backup: correct string encoding between py 2 and 3

Correcting encode() and decode() methods of 8-bit and Unicode
string objects.

In Python 2, Both 8-bit and Unicode strings had both methods
and the type of the return value was based on the specific
encoding passed in.

In Python 3, Text strings only have an encode() method, and
that method can only be used with codecs that produce bytes
objects. Similarly bytes and bytearray objects only have a
decode() method which can only be used with codecs that
produce string objects.

Change-Id: I214a786858655b8caf9612f3da5403c7d0bb7387
Closes-Bug: #1831735

commit_message:
Resolve multiple warnings

install-deps: Avoid ignored failure to install python2-libselinux,
something that should have being avoided from start (probably a lefover
hack from when we were adding fedora28 support).
Fixes: "Error: Nothing to do"

install-deps: Avoid PIP warnings related to where we were installing
executables ins ~/local/bin

repo-setup: remove deprecated syntax:
Avoid:
[DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using tests as filters is deprecated. Instead of using
`result|match` use `result is match`. This feature will be removed in version
2.9. Deprecation warnings can be disabled by setting deprecation_warnings=False
in ansible.cfg.

Change-Id: I8f1eaac3d58c2ceb5cb07ba41bc80107219bd4cc

commit_message:
Retain one default for overcloud_container_cli

Previously overcloud_container_cli was defaulted in
three places - using different values and causing confusion.
This review leave the default in
roles/extras-common/defaults/main.yml and comments
the role default to refer there.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/679435

commit_message:
Disable voting on container-updates until 678695 is merged

We have a chicken and egg issue where we both need
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678695/ and
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679299/ to land so we can ahve the
container-updates job running on Podman and not Docker.

The reason is because we can't run Podman when Pacemaker is enabled on
CentOS7, so 679299 would never pass. We are going to break the CI job
when 679299 merges but 679299 will fix it by disabling Pacemaker.

This patch will be reverted soon after 678695 is merged.

Change-Id: Ie7e1a78238fcea22032bda1162006582dc8c1fe3

commit_message:
Use upper constraints from opendev.org

oslo.cache uses a simple curl command in its tox_install.sh
to fetch the upper-constraints, and curl does not follow redirects
that are now in place due to move to opendev.org.

This breaks running tox-based tests w/o overriding the
UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE which upstream CI does,
for example running tox locally.

Change-Id: I209a980f3345e037a7a9a1d9f89925e6eefa0c4e
(cherry picked from commit aee2164a3a91e120649e67301e8b365a4691770c)

commit_message:
Allow to globally set no_containers

Previously no_containers could be set only for specified host group.
This patch adds option to define no_containers inside global_overrides
to set fully bare_metal deployment across all host groups.

Change-Id: I375ce28cdb7489af631d4ad41dc1ecaa78bd6d49

Change I6e086e0a2bffe12fd78373b3bc6215221dabc77e made the
_cleanup_running_deleted_instances task run immediately on
start of the nova-compute service. For some compute drivers, like
ironic, the "hypervisor" might not yet be ready to list instances
which results in a traceback exception in the logs.

This simply handles the VirtDriverNotReady error and returns to
avoid the traceback.

Change-Id: I6220a59988502a9839645efa101d555c19d4b650
Closes-Bug: #1842081
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Handle VirtDriverNotReady in _cleanup_running_deleted_instances

Change I6e086e0a2bffe12fd78373b3bc6215221dabc77e made the
_cleanup_running_deleted_instances task run immediately on
start of the nova-compute service. For some compute drivers, like
ironic, the "hypervisor" might not yet be ready to list instances
which results in a traceback exception in the logs.

This simply handles the VirtDriverNotReady error and returns to
avoid the traceback.

Change-Id: I6220a59988502a9839645efa101d555c19d4b650
Closes-Bug: #1842081

subject: Remove flake8 from the test-requirements
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-20 10:03:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove flake8 from the test-requirements

the linter is a blacklisted dependency, so we don't want to
pull it in for unit tests, as that causes any setup.py driven
build/install process to require flake8, which is not actually needed.

Also update to the newer flake8 2.6.x which is needed by current
hacking (which causes no fallout so should be fine).

Change-Id: I54f99e7e29c7b3727db98bdaf8bc168da3890a1d
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-08-13 15:34:09.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove flake8 from the test-requirements

flake8 is a linter so we don't need to pull in for the unit
tests or other tox environments.

Also update to the newer flake8 2.6.x which is the version
chosen by current hacking release (which causes no fallout so should be fine).
Also this is the first version that is compatible being run
under python 3.6/7.

Change-Id: I54f99e7e29c7b3727db98bdaf8bc168da3890a1d
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Remove flake8 from the test-requirements

flake8 is a linter so we don't need to pull in for the unit
tests or other tox environments.

Also update to the newer flake8 2.6.x which is the version
chosen by current hacking release (which causes no fallout so should be fine).
Also this is the first version that is compatible being run
under python 3.6/7.

Change-Id: I54f99e7e29c7b3727db98bdaf8bc168da3890a1d

commit_message:
Follow-up: fix the invalid releasenote link

By reviewing OSC's releasenote document [1], I found that the
blueprint index is invalid. This patch fixes this problem.

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-openstackclient/unreleased.html#new-features

Related-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665336
Part of blueprint support-specifying-az-when-restore-shelved-server

Change-Id: I14066dcfff5a585d51b4f365883a86a5cc086d45

commit_message:
Avoid Kuryrnet populating pools before namespace handler finishes

This patch sets ensures kuryrnet handler does not start with the
pools prepopulation for a newly created subnets as soon as the
kuryrnet crd object is created, but waits for the namespace handler
to complete the namespace creation actions (subnet creations, sgs,
and finally namespace annotations with kuryrnetcrd)

Change-Id: Id85eace3763a67d404e3785003490478734af3c9

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-26 21:49:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP/PoC: Use SDK instead of ironicclient for node.list

We would like nova not to use ironicclient, but instead to invoke the
ironic API directly through an openstacksdk connection.

The parent commits set up the framework, and this commit uses it
for GET /v1/nodes [1].

The API call is invoked via the nodes SDK method [2].

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/baremetal/?expanded=show-node-details-detail#list-nodes
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/openstacksdk/latest/user/proxies/baremetal.html#openstack.baremetal.v1._proxy.Proxy.nodes

Change-Id: I751c36f76d726c55b397c62e3059911c2a7af107
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-04-29 21:48:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use SDK instead of ironicclient for node.list

commit_message:
Use SDK for node.list

We would like nova not to use ironicclient, but instead to invoke the
ironic API directly through an openstacksdk connection.

The parent commits set up the framework, and this commit uses it
for GET /v1/nodes [1].

The API call is invoked via the nodes SDK method [2].

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/baremetal/?expanded=show-node-details-detail#list-nodes
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/openstacksdk/latest/user/proxies/baremetal.html#openstack.baremetal.v1._proxy.Proxy.nodes

NOTE: limit=0 has been removed in openstack/nova/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py:643,671,686,772.
      This is because the SDK returns a generator and handles paging transparently.

Blueprint: openstacksdk-in-nova
Change-Id: I751c36f76d726c55b397c62e3059911c2a7af107

commit_message:
Release monasca-statsd 1.12.0 for train

This releases not functional changes so they are included in the
stable/train branch. Minor version bump needed to ensure there is space
for any bugfix backports.

Change-Id: I395f3148b051eb2bd0a7bfafab6db0e34a05614c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Release ceilometermiddleware 1.5.0
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-04 16:41:21.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/train/ceilometermiddleware.yaml'], 'message': 'Release ceilometermiddleware 1.5.0

commit_message:
Release ceilometermiddleware 1.5.0

Forcing a release to have a good point to create stable/train branch.
We need to bump up the minor release to have room in case of bugfix
backports.

Change-Id: I1a199c96e165c82b96be0d2b049cd7b2dc464bb1
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
train: release osc-placement 1.7.0

Minor version bump since there are new features.

$ git log --no-merges --oneline --no-decorate 1.6.0..origin/master
8bbca01 Follow up for Ib0cbb58d0adbbcfe83ee48d2ff6c9af1a516a7ae
5cf7d77 Add --dry-run option to 'resource provider inventory set'
0ce562f Add --amend option to 'resource provider inventory set'
f08cb39 Add --aggregate option to 'resource provider inventory set'
51c0064 Cap sphinx for py2 to match global requirements

Change-Id: Ic0de7b7a05fefc930d507d150689dfe3cf07c598

subject: testinfra : add system-config as required project
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-05 22:36:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "testinfra : add system-config as required project

Because this job is defined in system-config repo, when it runs there
it has system-config.  When we're trying to run it against upstream
testinfra we need to ensure we pull it in explicitly.

Change-Id: I2bbba366501f10744ffaf26d1acfa54d652afae3
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-09-05 22:44:38.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/projects.yaml'], 'message': "testinfra : add system-config as required project

Because this job is defined in system-config repo, when it runs there
it has system-config.  When we're trying to run it against upstream
testinfra we need to ensure we pull it in explicitly.

Change-Id: I2bbba366501f10744ffaf26d1acfa54d652afae3
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
testinfra : add system-config as required project

Because this job is defined in system-config repo, when it runs there
it has system-config.  When we're trying to run it against upstream
testinfra we need to ensure we pull it in explicitly.

Change-Id: I2bbba366501f10744ffaf26d1acfa54d652afae3

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-07 15:12:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add 'arch_tag' fact to the container tag when building non x86_64 images

We will soon be pushing ppc64le container images  to registry.rdoproject.org
and need to tag images uniquely from the x86_64 versions. This patch adds an
arch_tag, of the format '_{{ansible_architecture}}' to the tag of the images
when ansible_architecture is not x86_64. Upon promotion, the arch_tag should
be removed from the tag, a manifest should be created, and the images should
be uploaded to dockerhub.

Change-Id: I537f577c8946ffeeed989a7c686ff85fef96a3f7

", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2019-08-06 20:38:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Introduce arch aware tag for container images

We will soon be pushing ppc64le container images  to
registry.rdoproject.org and need to tag images uniquely from
the x86_64 versions. This patch adds a suffix of the format
'_{{ansible_architecture}}' to the tag of the images. To ensure
backwards compatibility, x86_64 will also use the current tag
of format {{ version_hash }}. The retagging ansible scripts
are modified from an older patchset [0]. Upon promotion, the
suffix should be removed from the tag, a manifest should be
created, and the images should be uploaded to dockerhub.

commit_message:
Introduce arch aware tag for container images

We will soon be pushing ppc64le container images to
registry.rdoproject.org and need to tag images uniquely from
the x86_64 versions. This patch adds a suffix of the format
'_{{ansible_architecture}}' to the tag of the images. To ensure
backwards compatibility, x86_64 will also use the current tag
of format {{ version_hash }}. The retagging ansible scripts
are modified from an older patchset [0]. Upon promotion, the
suffix should be removed from the tag, a manifest should be
created, and the images should be uploaded to dockerhub.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/660665/

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/678907

Co-Authored-By: Rafael Folco <rfolco@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I537f577c8946ffeeed989a7c686ff85fef96a3f7

commit_message:
Enforce pep8/pyflakes rule on python codes

This change makes sure that we apply pyflake8 checks on all python
codes to improve its readability.

Note that there are some rules applied for other OpenStack projects,
but not yet turned on, which should be enabled in the future.

Change-Id: Iaf0299983d3a3fe48e3beb8f47bd33c21deb4972

commit_message:

This reverts commit b5dec5b676a51cc9736d99dd67484a97aba47090 and
doesn't use exit_codes to add allowed exit code 5, which is what broke
the standalone CI job.

commit_message:
Do not perform the tenant stack limit check for admin user

Removing stack creation limit for admin since admin can view all stacks,
and stacks created by other tenants would have been counted in the limit
check.

Change-Id: Ie2e9251245e7e16309661154e17724e5984c21e6
Story: 2003487
Task: 24756
(cherry picked from commit 22b14ff975f885c26b861d4d1b22577cca189e04)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-03 22:44:30.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Tox: Make OS_* vars available to tests

Functional tests were failing because the testing environment was
unable to access the Internet without a HTTP proxy (available via
OS_HTTP_PROXY). This commits tells Tox to pass through OS_* vars.

Change-Id: I34abee914ffa7a0ee7711bf5cc01dba0241af9e4
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Tox: Make OS_* vars available to tests

Functional tests were failing because the testing environment was
unable to access the Internet without a HTTP proxy (available via
OS_HTTP_PROXY). This commits tells Tox to pass through OS_* vars.

Change-Id: I34abee914ffa7a0ee7711bf5cc01dba0241af9e4

commit_message:
Use connect_retries when creating clients

When creating session clients we should use 'connect_retries'
for clients that use Adapter interface. This will
allow retries when we get ConnectTimeout errors.

Task: 36331
Change-Id: Ic526c8039c91353e772eee7b55f1d263470c86bb
(cherry picked from commit 364716725a4767f8d9e3e5e1c76ecf4f969a6613
 and c7cc740f307ce8ffdf36c29094c9cbce5a6c8d14)

so we know that tempest- created it.

commit_message:
Fix resource leaks in IdentityPolicyAssociationRbacTest class

The IdentityPolicyAssociationRbacTest,
IdentityEndpointsV3RbacTest and EndpointFilterProjectsV3RbacTest
test cases were leaking region resources on the endpoint create
and just using tempest- in the region description.
The following changes to fix the leaks and make them easier to
find in the future, if they happen.

1) move setup_test_endpoint to the v3 class to have access to the
region client and get the region id created when the endpoint
created so I can add it to the resource clean-up.
2) add a rand_name for the region id not just the description
so we know that tempest- created it.

Change-Id: I3bd5bf02ef6d434ccba65a5a732e550b007a2309

subject: Run scenario tests with --concurrency=2 in tempest-full job
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-05 14:24:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Run scenario tests with --concurrency=2 in tempest-full job

We're still seeing lots of job timeouts from tempest-full
which excludes slow tests but still times out at a high rate [1].

Looking at stackviz results for a tempest-full job that passed,
it is clear that a good chunk of time is being spent running
scenario tests in serial even though we have 4 workers available.

In an attempt to speed this up but still try to be somewhat
conservative in how scenario tests are run concurrently, this
changes the tempest-full job to run the scenario tests with two
workers concurrently rather than serially.

The alternatives are:

1. Profile which tests are taking the longest and figure out why
   and then try to make them faster (best but hard to do).
2. Mark more tests as slow (easy but that just shifts the long
   running tests to the tempest-slow job which already has a 3
   hour timeout).
3. Re-consider if SSH validation should be enabled for tempest-full
   in the integrated gate and instead move that to some other
   dedicated job that does SSH validation (easy to do, but more
   redundant jobs which increases the chances of gate bugs to
   randomly fail a new voting job).
4. Extend the timeout on the tempest-full job (easy to do but it
   is already a 2 hour timeout).
5. Go through tempest's existing tests and figure out what should
   be moved to per-project plugins so they are not part of the
   integrated gate, assuming those tests aren't part of the
   interop guidelines in refstack (harder to do but probably good
   to do long-term anyway).

[1] http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/#1783405

Change-Id: I65db5259132ec8a1a084032c2632e49677a0fb66
Related-Bug: #1783405

commit_message:
Run scenario tests with --concurrency=2 in tempest-full job

We're still seeing lots of job timeouts from tempest-full
which excludes slow tests but still times out at a high rate [1].

Looking at stackviz results for a tempest-full job that passed,
it is clear that a good chunk of time is being spent running
scenario tests in serial even though we have 4 workers available.

In an attempt to speed this up but still try to be somewhat
conservative in how scenario tests are run concurrently, this
changes the tempest-full job to run the scenario tests with two
workers concurrently rather than serially.

The alternatives are:

1. Profile which tests are taking the longest and figure out why
   and then try to make them faster (best but hard to do).
2. Mark more tests as slow (easy but that just shifts the long
   running tests to the tempest-slow job which already has a 3
   hour timeout).
3. Re-consider if SSH validation should be enabled for tempest-full
   in the integrated gate and instead move that to some other
   dedicated job that does SSH validation (easy to do, but more
   redundant jobs which increases the chances of gate bugs to
   randomly fail a new voting job).
4. Extend the timeout on the tempest-full job (easy to do but it
   is already a 2 hour timeout).
5. Go through tempest's existing tests and figure out what should
   be moved to per-project plugins so they are not part of the
   integrated gate, assuming those tests aren't part of the
   interop guidelines in refstack (harder to do but probably good
   to do long-term anyway).

[1] http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/#1783405

Change-Id: I65db5259132ec8a1a084032c2632e49677a0fb66
Related-Bug: #1783405

commit_message:
WIP: libvirt: dump console log if _clean_shutdown fails

We're seeing cirros guests in the gate failing to gracefully
shutdown within 60 seconds which is strange since they shouldn't
really be doing anything, and this could be contributing to
long test times and/or job timeouts.

This change is a simple debug patch to dump the guest console
log if we fail to cleanly shutdown the guest before destroying it.

Change-Id: I1bc1fe82ac015a92fe51d7dc5bd916b4a85c69e3
Related-Bug: #1829896

commit_message:
Use separate plays for Host prep steps

Instead of using one task include per role in the same play, use
separate plays instead. This reduces the amount of task skipping that
Ansible has to do since each include only applies to a single role.

In a deployment with many roles, this will improve performance.

Change-Id: I01ef631ea3dad8b9c030d61ed0883a9af13616ad

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 20:15:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'message': 'Trap and log errors from _update_inst_info_cache_for_disassociated_fip

When associating a floating IP to instance A and the floating IP is
already associated to instance B, the associate_floating_ip method
updates the floating IP to be associated with instance A then tries
to update the network info cache for instance B. That network info
cache update is best effort and could fail in different ways, e.g.
the original associated port or instance could be gone. Failing to
refresh the cache for instance B should not affect the association
operation for instance A, so this change traps any errors during the
refresh and just logs them as a warning.

Change-Id: Ib5a44e4fd2ec2bf43b761db29403810d8b730429
Related-Bug: #1826472
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Trap and log errors from _update_inst_info_cache_for_disassociated_fip

When associating a floating IP to instance A and the floating IP is
already associated to instance B, the associate_floating_ip method
updates the floating IP to be associated with instance A then tries
to update the network info cache for instance B. That network info
cache update is best effort and could fail in different ways, e.g.
the original associated port or instance could be gone. Failing to
refresh the cache for instance B should not affect the association
operation for instance A, so this change traps any errors during the
refresh and just logs them as a warning.

Change-Id: Ib5a44e4fd2ec2bf43b761db29403810d8b730429
Related-Bug: #1826472

commit_message:
neutron: refactor nw info cache refresh out of associate_floating_ip

This is a simple refactor to associate_floating_ip which moves
the code that handles refreshing the network info cache on the
instance originally associated with the floating IP out of the
main associate_floating_ip method. This is mostly to make unit
testing of that refesh code simpler in isolation.

Change-Id: Ie5d2724e61052756dc7239f25b1fb6eb0df96378

subject: Self-resetting PrivContext
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 23:59:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: Self-resetting PrivContext

When nova-compute, an oslo.service, receives SIGHUP, running PrivContext
clients terminate, resulting in the shutdown of their corresponding
ClientChannel threads. Subsequent attempts to execute privileged methods
fail with EPIPE as a result.

The PrivContext._wrap'per (the meat of the entrypoint decorator) already
had a check to lazily start() the ClientChannel if that hasn't already
happened.

This commit makes ClientChannel store state indicating whether it's
still running; and adds logic to PrivContext._wrap to check that state
and reset (stop() and re-start()) the ClientChannel if it was previously
created but terminated.

Closes-Bug: #1715374

commit_message:
Self-resetting PrivContext

When nova-compute, an oslo.service, receives SIGHUP, running PrivContext
clients terminate, resulting in the shutdown of their corresponding
ClientChannel threads. Subsequent attempts to execute privileged methods
fail with EPIPE as a result.

The PrivContext._wrap'per (the meat of the entrypoint decorator) already
had a check to lazily start() the ClientChannel if that hasn't already
happened.

This commit makes ClientChannel store state indicating whether it's
still running; and adds logic to PrivContext._wrap to check that state
and reset (stop() and re-start()) the ClientChannel if it was previously
created but terminated.

Change-Id: I8096fc7fd014e6dd299fae8ab073336c7cae362a
Closes-Bug: #1715374

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-08 03:14:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "restart: don't stop process on sighup

It seems that the code for handling SIGHUP currently calls stop()
on the service, then calls reset(), then calls start() on it again.

This is effectively a full service restart, which breaks the whole
point behind using SIGHUP for hot and quick reloads.  It also breaks
our downstream projects in a few ways where they lose RPC on reload
due to the fact that they don't expect to have stop() called on a
reset().

This patch removes the stop() and start() functionality, allowing
processes to reset exactly what they want in their code.

Change-Id: I86a34c22d41d87a9cce2d4ac6d95562d05823ecf
Closes-Bug: #1715374
Closes-Bug: #1794708

on the service, then calls reset(), then calls start() on it again.

This is effectively a full service restart, which breaks the whole

our downstream projects in a few ways where they lose RPC on reload
due to the fact that they don't expect to have stop() called on a
reset().

This patch removes the stop() and start() functionality, allowing
processes to reset exactly what they want in their code.

Change-Id: I86a34c22d41d87a9cce2d4ac6d95562d05823ecf
Closes-Bug: #1715374
Closes-Bug: #1794708
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2019-07-19 17:23:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "restart: don't stop process on sighup when mutating

It seems that the code for handling SIGHUP currently calls stop()
on the service, then calls reset(), then calls start() on it again.

This is effectively a full service restart, which breaks the whole
point behind using SIGHUP for hot and quick reloads.  It also breaks
our downstream projects in a few ways where they lose RPC on reload
due to the fact that they don't expect to have stop() called on a
reset().

This patch removes the stop and start when the restart_method is
set to 'mutate' because in that case we should just be signaling
the service to check for changes in its mutable config options.
It also changes the signal sent to children in that case to
SIGHUP, since SIGTERM will cause unnecessary restarts of child
processes.

The previous behavior is maintained for the 'reload' restart_method
since that does a complete reload of the service config, which is
not safe to do without restarting the service completely.

Change-Id: I86a34c22d41d87a9cce2d4ac6d95562d05823ecf
Closes-Bug: #1715374
Closes-Bug: #1794708
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>

commit_message:
restart: don't stop process on sighup when mutating

It seems that the code for handling SIGHUP currently calls stop()
on the service, then calls reset(), then calls start() on it again.

This is effectively a full service restart, which breaks the whole
point behind using SIGHUP for hot and quick reloads.  It also breaks
our downstream projects in a few ways where they lose RPC on reload
due to the fact that they don't expect to have stop() called on a
reset().

This patch removes the stop and start when the restart_method is
set to 'mutate' because in that case we should just be signaling
the service to check for changes in its mutable config options.
It also changes the signal sent to children in that case to
SIGHUP, since SIGTERM will cause unnecessary restarts of child
processes.

The previous behavior is maintained for the 'reload' restart_method
since that does a complete reload of the service config, which is
not safe to do without restarting the service completely.

Change-Id: I86a34c22d41d87a9cce2d4ac6d95562d05823ecf
Closes-Bug: #1794708
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>

Enable overcloud_upgrade only for master to master jobs

In order to run master to master jobs, we need to enable
the tags for overcloud_upgrade only

commit_message:
update to use emit_releases for fs051

It looks like fs051 is not configured to use
the emit_releases python script that determines
the correct release for deployments, updates,
and upgrades.

target_upgrade_version should be defined with
this patch included.

Closes-Bug: #1811450
Depends-On: Ie0612902c0b6ca00ce5b9bea3690d6131e9e4bfe
Depends-On: I73e38cf5be601fc22d1509b05c08b7d520c50064
Change-Id: Ifcbff4c848b24641f8f937db0745b0483a05a437

commit_message:
Modify validation and add Molecule tests for rabbitmq-limits

We can't easily add host variables, meaning we have to modify the
validation in order to accept external variable.

The Molecule test validate it's still working as expected.

Change-Id: I81edce1f949c0ad38d4ccef2a94a45f455cd9a9c

commit_message:
Set ceph_grafana_vip on storage_dashboard network

When storage_dashboard composable network is defined, we need
to set ceph_grafana_vip on this network following the same
pattern of the other services and creating an exception.
If storage_dashboard composable network is not defined, no
additional changes are needed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674318
Change-Id: Ib393e2e65821e347179c0c20b87feb99d6d84982
Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fluentd: Add support for arbitrary environment vars

This updates the Fluentd deployment template to use the helm
toolkit util for generating environment variables through the
chart's values.yaml. This adds flexibility in defining fluentd
outputs, as arbitrary environment variables can be injected and
consumed in fluentd's filters and outputs

Change-Id: I72a2c476378cc555bde1387781b4a06f13b51bc6

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: Ide4de6aa418aa9ee66fca41378677b73312a847d
Story: #2005924
Task: #34206

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Story: #2005924
Task: #34208

Change-Id: I2dee048b71e3758208fae438423cceae661c8f00

commit_message:
temporary disable functional tests

we have to merge python3-train changes but new bug in keystone
prevents this commit.
we have fix for keystone and we checked that functional job passes
with that fix.
so I suggest to switch off functional job to merge python3-train
and then I'll revert functional job

keystone fix: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677239/

Change-Id: I939821aee613895672c61a575a0700e55ce4a3b8

subject: Revert "Raise NotFound error when retrieved by not uuid"
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-20 22:49:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Revert "Raise NotFound error when retrieved by not uuid"

In the early days of OpenStack, user and project ids were not
uuids, but auto-incremented integers.

Since those early days, many operators fought long battles
against the unrelenting OpenStack behemoth.

Only those heroic operators who emerged victorious from the
brutal upgrade battles can show the scars of those integer
user and project ids like badges of honour.

Change-Id: I0c3e3465e8e7499c94d1a82b7295aeec13955e55
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-08-29 23:00:03.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/keystone.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Raise NotFound error when retrieved by not uuid"

uuids, but auto-incremented integers.

against the unrelenting OpenStack behemoth.

Only those heroic operators who emerged victorious from the

Closes-Bug: #1842004
Change-Id: I0c3e3465e8e7499c94d1a82b7295aeec13955e55
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Revert "Raise NotFound error when retrieved by not uuid"

In the early days of OpenStack, user and project ids were not
uuids, but auto-incremented integers.

Since those early days, many operators fought long battles
against the unrelenting OpenStack behemoth.

Only those heroic operators who emerged victorious from the
brutal upgrade battles can show the scars of those integer
user and project ids like badges of honour.

Closes-Bug: #1842004
Change-Id: I0c3e3465e8e7499c94d1a82b7295aeec13955e55

commit_message:
Don't allow retype to encrypted+multiattach type

This maintains consistency with our policy of not allowing the
combination of encryption and multiattach in commit
18327971ca7231807294a6b1dbf3d80c23cb6796

Change-Id: I1c22bc86d96bb1cab80c004d3450b1dac6c4a769

commit_message:
Fluentd: Add support for daemonset update strategy

This adds support for configuring fluentd's update strategy when
deployed as a daemonset, as this was previously missed when
the changes to support both daemonsets and deployments were made

Change-Id: I5ac4fbfc0e64caaf207de42cd71c893f8d0f6ff1
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I323b079ec538ebc2184724325fad00bbe2092e9b

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I9a106c17947055aa080fbea022d1abb4bd75f2b1

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- Passing OS env vars instead of AMULET
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.
- adding bionic-stein bundle to gate_bundles instead of dev

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: Ia7093a5654a763670be05635f7f6fce292eb9c96

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718

Change-Id: Ica4bead71d054ae5912e7e66ff9a0666e131637a

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- changed the location of memcached dur to an issue with the charm store
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718

Change-Id: Idf5e729fcde85ff7442282a711130f4132e17a85

commit_message:
Adds API-Schema guideline

This is the initial place holder for API Schema guidance document.
Since there are no specs file this also describes the current situation
and what to do to obtain the API schemas.

Change-Id: I9e781fb67de281d642f5b2ac7a41ae0e178c0adb

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 20:47:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Always specify interface for vips

Currently the interfaces end up being detected during the deploy however
this only works when the undercloud_*_host configurations use the same
ip cidr as the local_ip. We should define this to be the br-ctlplane by
default, however this may need to be configured differently when the
user is using their on network configuration override.  We will also
throw warnings about these configurations when this type of
configuration occurs. The end user can override these via their own
custom env file if they want the vips to end up on a different
interface.

Change-Id: I32b44184a840ec7932a812ce0fabaa0256061993
Closes-Bug: #1841850

commit_message:
Always specify interface for vips

Currently the interfaces end up being detected during the deploy however
this only works when the undercloud_*_host configurations use the same
ip cidr as the local_ip. We should define this to be the br-ctlplane by
default, however this may need to be configured differently when the
user is using their on network configuration override.  We will also
throw warnings about these configurations when this type of
configuration occurs. The end user can override these via their own
custom env file if they want the vips to end up on a different
interface.

Change-Id: I32b44184a840ec7932a812ce0fabaa0256061993
Closes-Bug: #1841850

commit_message:
temporary disable functional tests

we have to merge python3-train changes but new bug in keystone
prevents this commit.
we have fix for keystone and we checked that functional job passes
with that fix.
so I suggest to switch off functional job to merge python3-train
and then I'll revert functional job

keystone fix: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677239/

commit_message:
Fix 'test_get_devices_info_veth_different_namespaces' failure

If there is already a separate interface or bridge in namespace,
adding an interface to namespace will result in a link device by default.
Closes-Bug: #1842482

Change-Id: I4c8ffb258a3e1ef6c30f27eb0a1ead2de6f208a7

subject: Patch DNS lookups in Unit tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-01 23:30:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Patch DNS lookups in Unit tests

Currently the unit testing suite has a minimal set of IPs
hard-coded (in the subnet 10.0.0.0/8). The failing unit tests call
functions that will perform DNS reverse lookups on the hard-coded
IPs. In the event that a DNS server is unavailable, or misconfigured,
the DNS lookups will result in a Python Exception being thrown,
causing the unit tests to fail.

This solution patches DNS lookups to return None result.

Change-Id: I7a519fbe7fba5f3aefd22c57b8d44e3b39c99582
Closes-Bug: #1841806
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-09-04 20:35:23.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_nova_cc_hooks.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Patch DNS lookups in Unit tests

Currently the unit testing suite has a minimal set of IPs
hard-coded (in the subnet 10.0.0.0/8). The failing unit tests call
functions that will perform DNS reverse lookups on the hard-coded
IPs. In the event that a DNS server is unavailable, or misconfigured,
the DNS lookups will result in a Python Exception being thrown,
causing the unit tests to fail.

This solution patches DNS lookups to return None result.

Also add OS_* to tox passenv to resolve the http proxy issue in
retrieving the cirros image.

Change-Id: I7a519fbe7fba5f3aefd22c57b8d44e3b39c99582
Closes-Bug: #1841806
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Patch DNS lookups in Unit tests

Currently the unit testing suite has a minimal set of IPs
hard-coded (in the subnet 10.0.0.0/8). The failing unit tests call
functions that will perform DNS reverse lookups on the hard-coded
IPs. In the event that a DNS server is unavailable, or misconfigured,
the DNS lookups will result in a Python Exception being thrown,
causing the unit tests to fail.

This solution patches DNS lookups to return None result.

Also add OS_* to tox passenv to resolve the http proxy issue in
retrieving the cirros image.

Change-Id: I7a519fbe7fba5f3aefd22c57b8d44e3b39c99582
Closes-Bug: #1841806

The block-device is a parameter of nova-client command, using it

commit_message:
Docs: Fix launch an instance from a volume

The block-device is a parameter of nova-client command, using it
in OSC will raise CommandError.

Also we can use "--volume" for the instance
boot from an existing source image, volume, or snapshot.

Change-Id: Iadf1b6757c28db80312bae4d1ed385e5a1a4184f

commit_message:
Libvirt: Rename _guest_add_memory_balloon

The virtual memory balloon device will be added by
Libvirt as a default behavior.[1]

The option mem_stats_period_seconds only set guest memory
statistics period.

Closes-Bug: #1840139

[1] https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsMemBalloon

Change-Id: Id87695de562393ecd608fb7cb463f612f3f18f9f

commit_message:
Rename cinder distro packages to match convention

This patch splits distro variables into two:
- cinder_*_distro_packages defines dependant packages
- cinder_*_service_distro_packages defines cinder service packages itself

So that we're installing cinder_*_distro_packages both for source and distro
installs while cinder_*_service_distro_packages are only for distro ones.

Also since only qemu-tools depends on librbd, we leave it alone in
cinder_volume_distro_packages_tools.

Change-Id: I746c800dc75b39f57f7c707aedf35f6814cfdef0

We attempt a reset but if the installation is being run in a non-tty
friendly way, reset may fail.  Since this isn't really a blocking issue
we shouldn't fail out of the installation but rather log a warning

commit_message:
Log a warning when reset fails

We attempt a reset but if the installation is being run in a non-tty
friendly way, reset may fail.  Since this isn't really a blocking issue
we shouldn't fail out of the installation but rather log a warning
indicating that the user may need to perform some action.

Change-Id: I26f41457b712810b54d4108f735a1db3c88ae8ce
Closes-Bug: #1842677

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: I07d08bb2c5ea351dc2ad697c5889bd97d04f7c7c

subject: Check if workflow execution is empty in integrity checker
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-05 06:51:22.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/engine/workflow_handler.py'], 'message': 'Check if workflow execution is empty in integrity checker

* Method get_workflow_execution() raises an exception if the workflow
  execution does not exist. Since this is a valid case (the method
  may be called via scheduler after the execution is deleted)
  we need to smoothly handle it.

commit_message:
Check if workflow execution is empty in integrity checker

* Method get_workflow_execution() raises an exception if the workflow
  execution does not exist. Since this is a valid case (the method
  may be called via scheduler after the execution is deleted)
  we need to smoothly handle it.

Change-Id: Ibd6099f1e0fd07c71130f11457b355a367229977

commit_message:
add table of available cleaning steps to documentation

The documentation currently has no information at all about what steps
are available *generally* for automated or manual cleaning. Users who
want to find this information must review the source code themselves,
except in one or two cases where driver-specific documentation has the
details spelled out.

This patch adds a series of tables to the general cleaning
documentation to provide details about the steps one could possibly
add to the instructions given to ironic, along with details about
required parameters and what the effect of each step will be.

Change-Id: I6b225cce38b815248c457814508531041c437e6d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- Adding bionic stein test
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I405577811e23918aca946f7a7da2adaf54678dcc

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- Added test bundles bionic-queens, bionic-rocky, disco-stein
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718

Change-Id: Ie314f8e8914bce87606bbce442ebd28bc5be4bce

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I9b7ff0d629043e688e9cd7b89d95bdd3b3d6c77b

Add Drive resource support

This change adds basic Redfish Drive resource support to the
dynamic Redfish emulator. As of this patch, the only backend
for the Redfish Drives implemented is static config (Flask)
file.

commit_message:
Add Storage and Storage Controllers resource support

This change adds basic Redfish Storage and Storage Controllers
support to the dynamic Redfish emulator. As of this patch, the
only backend for the Redfish Storage implemented is static
config (Flask) file.

Change-Id: I250d84e6edd3c867809068a1a6b9c28e6756cbaf

commit_message:
Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: I6fbddc841039a9a66998b4ca7ae81742852d12ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-13 10:53:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Libvirt: add nfv job

- This change introduces nfv nodesets that are based on fedora-29
- This change introduces tempest-nfv and tempest-nfv-multinode jobs
- This change disables gate jobs to speed up developemnt of the nfv
  jobs.

The tempest-nfv job uses the qemu multi threaded tiny code
generator backend (MTTCG) to enable cpu pinning without kvm.
This requires a recent qemu and libvit 5.1.rc2 or newer.
libvirt 5.1.rc2 removes a hardcoded check that prevents cpu
pinning being enabled when qemu is used without kvm.
qemu automatically enables the MTTCG backed on supported
architechtures when a compatible cpu model is used.
To "force" the use of MTTCG we use cpu_mode=custom
and set the cpu_model to qemu64.

The tempest-nfv job operates by executing the standard
tempest test suite using nfv flavors to ensure that standard
operation function when using cpu pinning, hugepages, realtime
and an explicit numa topology of 1 numa node. addtionally
this tests emulator_threads isolate and share.

Change-Id: I8884a20d1cd81f5c43f43ed6575990110d75bc37
