commit_message:
Add conditional field matching

Adds the ability to conditionally match sushy fields against
received JSON object.

The conditional matching is performed by a user-supplied callable
which gets the key to consider (along with the value and potentially
other details) and should indicate the the caller if the match
occurred.

The motivation behind this change is to accommodate malformed Redfish
resource properties as observed in the OEM wilderness.

Change-Id: I9da9a83b72b670e15b53ef906f186473340c0935

subject: Allocations leaked during migration rollback
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-22 14:23:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Allocations leaked during migration rollback

Allocations committed against the destination host are not reverted
during live migration rollbacks. The reason is that we're not passing
the migrate data object properly.

At some point, the rollback callback signature has changed. We picked
it up but only for the main (non-cluster) driver:
I5f247d733642464f4ede0430d4dfc8a27a02e7fd

This change addresses the cluster driver as well.

Change-Id: I8c509d411b8fdf7e65622f1fbb2095fe9c3b98b5
Closes-Bug: #1841068
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-09-03 11:51:06.000000000', 'files': ['compute_hyperv/nova/cluster/livemigrationops.py', 'compute_hyperv/tests/unit/cluster/test_livemigrationops.py'], 'message': "Allocations leaked during migration rollback

Allocations committed against the destination host are not reverted
during live migration rollbacks. The reason is that we're not passing
the migrate data object properly.

At some point, the rollback callback signature has changed. We picked
it up but only for the main (non-cluster) driver:
I5f247d733642464f4ede0430d4dfc8a27a02e7fd

This change addresses the cluster driver as well.

commit_message:
Allocations leaked during migration rollback

Allocations committed against the destination host are not reverted
during live migration rollbacks. The reason is that we're not passing
the migrate data object properly.

At some point, the rollback callback signature has changed. We picked
it up but only for the main (non-cluster) driver:
I5f247d733642464f4ede0430d4dfc8a27a02e7fd

This change addresses the cluster driver as well.

Change-Id: I8c509d411b8fdf7e65622f1fbb2095fe9c3b98b5
Closes-Bug: #1841068

commit_message:
re-calculate provider mapping during migration

Nova intentionally does not persist the resoruce request of the neturon
ports. Therefore during migration nova needs to query neturon about the
resource requests to include them to the allocation_candidates query
sent to placement during scheduling. Also when the allocation is made by
the scheduler nova needs to re-calculate request group - resource
provider mapping. A subsequent patch will use this mapping to update the
binding profile when the port is bound to the destination host of the
migration.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

Change-Id: I8e5a0480c81ba548bc1f50a8098eabac52b11453

subject: HA: fix <service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30126, 'name': 'Luca Miccini', 'email': 'lmiccini@redhat.com', 'username': 'lmiccini2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 16:56:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "HA: fix <service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow

For each HA service we have a paunch container <service>_restart_bundle
which is started by paunch whenever config files changes during stack
deploy/update. This container runs a pcs command on a single node to
restart all the service's containers (e.g. all galera on all controllers).
By design, when it is run, configs have already been regenerated by the
deploy tasks on all nodes.

For minor updates, the workflow runs differently: all the steps of the
deploy tasks are run one node after the other, so when
<service>_restart_bundle is called, there is no guarantee that the
service's configs have been regenerated on all the nodes yet.

To fix the wrong restart behaviour, only restart local containers when
running during a minor update. And run once per node. When the minor
update workflow calls <service>_restart_container, we still have the
guarantee that the config files are already regenerated locally.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45
Closes-Bug: #1841629
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-08-28 20:23:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "HA: fix <service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow

For each HA service we have a paunch container <service>_restart_bundle
which is started by paunch whenever config files changes during stack
deploy/update. This container runs a pcs command on a single node to
restart all the service's containers (e.g. all galera on all controllers).
By design, when it is run, configs have already been regenerated by the
deploy tasks on all nodes.

For minor updates, the workflow runs differently: all the steps of the
deploy tasks are run one node after the other, so when
<service>_restart_bundle is called, there is no guarantee that the
service's configs have been regenerated on all the nodes yet.

To fix the wrong restart behaviour, only restart local containers when
running during a minor update. And run once per node. When the minor
update workflow calls <service>_restart_container, we still have the
guarantee that the config files are already regenerated locally.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45
Closes-Bug: #1841629

restart all the service's containers (e.g. all galera on all controllers).
By design, when it is run, configs have already been regenerated by the
deploy tasks on all nodes.

For minor updates, the workflow runs differently: all the steps of the
deploy tasks are run one node after the other, so when
<service>_restart_bundle is called, there is no guarantee that the
service's configs have been regenerated on all the nodes yet.

To fix the wrong restart behaviour, only restart local containers when
running during a minor update. And run once per node. When the minor
update workflow calls <service>_restart_container, we still have the
guarantee that the config files are already regenerated locally.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45
Closes-Bug: #1841629

commit_message:
HA: fix <service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow

For each HA service we have a paunch container <service>_restart_bundle
which is started by paunch whenever config files changes during stack
deploy/update. This container runs a pcs command on a single node to
restart all the service's containers (e.g. all galera on all controllers).
By design, when it is run, configs have already been regenerated by the
deploy tasks on all nodes.

For minor updates, the workflow runs differently: all the steps of the
deploy tasks are run one node after the other, so when
<service>_restart_bundle is called, there is no guarantee that the
service's configs have been regenerated on all the nodes yet.

To fix the wrong restart behaviour, only restart local containers when
running during a minor update. And run once per node. When the minor
update workflow calls <service>_restart_container, we still have the
guarantee that the config files are already regenerated locally.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45
Closes-Bug: #1841629

commit_message:
telemetry-tempest-plugin: Switch to python3 only

There is only a python3 tempest version so it doesn't make sense to
have py2 and py3 for the telemetry plugin.
Also fix the Requires.

Change-Id: I57e4d21ab9a14d1733720e940f2ea8d49bd5c1dd

[{'created': '2019-03-05 00:13:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add 'aggregate allocation ratio set' batch command

This adds a batch command which takes an aggregate UUID and a
repeatable --resource <resource class>=<ratio> option and will set the
allocation ratios for the specified resources for each resource
provider that is a member of the specified aggregate.

This command is an attempt to give operators a tool to make setting
overcommit allocation ratios on a per-aggregate basis easier, after the
functionality from the old Aggregate[Core|Ram|Disk]Filter scheduler
filters was removed back in Ocata [1].

[1]

", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2019-04-06 01:36:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add 'resource provider inventory update' command

This adds a new 'update' command which can update resource provider
inventory without requiring the user to pass a full replacement for
inventory like the 'set' command requires. It does a GET for existing
inventory, applies user provided updates, and does a PUT of the updated
inventory.

The command also has the ability to batch inventory updates for all
resource providers that are members of a specified --aggregate. And it
has a --dry-run option to preview changes before effecting them.

The main motivation for this command is to give operators a tool to
make setting overcommit allocation ratios on a per-aggregate basis
easier, after the functionality from the old
Aggregate[Core|Ram|Disk]Filter scheduler filters was removed back in
Ocata [1].

Because the command is quite generic, operators can also use it to do
any inventory update without having to do the GET, update, PUT,
manually and batch any update for all resource provider members of an
aggregate.

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126283.html

Change-Id: Ib0cbb58d0adbbcfe83ee48d2ff6c9af1a516a7ae

commit_message:
Add --aggregate option to 'resource provider inventory set'

This adds a new '--aggregate' option which can set resource provider
inventory for all resource providers that are members of the specified
aggregate.

The main motivation for this option is to give operators a tool to
make setting overcommit allocation ratios on a per-aggregate basis
easier, after the functionality from the old
Aggregate[Core|Ram|Disk]Filter scheduler filters was removed back in
Ocata [1].

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126283.html

Story: 2006318
Task: 36189

Change-Id: Ib0cbb58d0adbbcfe83ee48d2ff6c9af1a516a7ae

commit_message:
Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: Ife8461f00ba2206d18ae45837bbc31d211e29841

commit_message:
Add PDF documentation build

This commit adds a new tox target to build PDF documentation.
It's a community goal[0] to have PDF docs available.

Also some minor fixes are needed for PDF:
- Only show genindex and search for HTML. Theses elements do not make
sense within PDF documents
- Do not include full config sample files. This will not work and
produces a "Dimension too large" error during the latex run.

[0]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/train/pdf-doc-generation.html

Change-Id: I66b8c47d599c97e66c2ca76faa66204d5e7c9c3b

commit_message:
Update driver interface

spawn() now accepts the "power_on" flag, allowing instances to be
created without being turned on. This is part of the cross-cell
migration workflow.

Change-Id: Ifd18a69f476ebbfb4ee6ec34abb03da0d2e30ceb

With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 14760, 'name': 'John L. Villalovos', 'email': 'openstack.org@sodarock.com', 'username': 'jlvillal'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-11 00:00:13.000000000', 'files': ['virtualbmc/vbmc.py'], 'message': "Fixes compatibility with python34

The xml package changed ElementTree with python 3.x to return a
bytestring when calling 'tostring' method as the default behavior.
Libvirt complains when trying to create the domain that it is expecting
a string.  This patch fixes the issue by specifying the encoding type as
unicode.  This should work for python 2.x and python 3.x.

Change-Id: I7f517b5f44f57a644ed5bc44097e3230311f980b
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixes compatibility with python34

The xml package changed ElementTree with python 3.x to return a
bytestring when calling 'tostring' method as the default behavior.
Libvirt complains when trying to create the domain that it is expecting
a string.  This patch fixes the issue by specifying the encoding type as
unicode.  This should work for python 2.x and python 3.x.

Change-Id: I7f517b5f44f57a644ed5bc44097e3230311f980b
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: I98d52f3b259cfffeb0e8ec996279ad4ff782276d

commit_message:
Add periodic logs during database mechanism

This patch will help operator and developer who can
follow actions during checking server status and
service status of creating/deleting mechanism.

Change-Id: I479628d66a9016750a21d9846358406e097525e5

commit_message:
Use SDK for setting instance id

We would like nova not to use ironicclient, but instead to invoke the
ironic API directly through an openstacksdk connection.

The parent commits set up the framework, and this commit uses it
for the _set_instance_id function.

Blueprint: openstacksdk-in-nova
Change-Id: I95f3414d29a5ff5cc49994bac1cda917edc4f292

subject: Skipping sg rule deletion for pods without annotations
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11600, 'name': 'Michał Dulko', 'email': 'mdulko@redhat.com', 'username': 'dulek'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27032, 'name': 'Maysa de Macedo Souza', 'email': 'maysa.macedo95@gmail.com', 'username': 'maysa'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 16:23:35.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_kubernetes/controller/handlers/vif.py'], 'message': 'Skipping sg rule deletion for pods without annotations

This patch set skips the error when NPs are enabled and a pod that
has not yet been annotated by kuryr is deleted (for instance a pod
in pending status). The information about the IP is found on the
annotations and as that is not already there no rules would have
been created. Thus no need to remove them.

Change-Id: I850dc2d66fac2d7b44267382062093b19e5cd442
Closes-Bug: 1842099
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Skipping sg rule deletion for pods without annotations

This patch set skips the error when NPs are enabled and a pod that
has not yet been annotated by kuryr is deleted (for instance a pod
in pending status). The information about the IP is found on the
annotations and as that is not already there no rules would have
been created. Thus no need to remove them.

Change-Id: I850dc2d66fac2d7b44267382062093b19e5cd442
Closes-Bug: 1842099

commit_message:
Extract SEV-specific bits on host detection

Extract reducedPhysBits and cbitpos when detecting that host is
SEV-enabled.

These parameters will later be used to configure the guest.
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#sev-launch-time-configuration

Change-Id: I1d9308147a389fc94b7e872f9bd0621bdb25b193
blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

commit_message:
Added information how to use JsonFilter

Creating a query hint to use JsonFilter that will choose
required backed to create a volume was complicated.
Added description how to use that will be helpful for others.

Change-Id: If04f037cf55b5b9d116927aa4b23a9c42d7b53e6
Co-authored-by: Bartosz Rabiega <bartosz.rabiega@corp.ovh.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-26 21:49:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP/PoC: Use SDK instead of ironicclient for checking instance exists

We would like nova not to use ironicclient, but instead to invoke the
ironic API directly through an openstacksdk connection.

The parent commits set up the framework, and this commit uses it
for the instance_exists function.

commit_message:
Use SDK for validating instance and node

We would like nova not to use ironicclient, but instead to invoke the
ironic API directly through an openstacksdk connection.

The parent commits set up the framework, and this commit uses it
for the instance_exists function.

Blueprint: openstacksdk-in-nova
Change-Id: I764b0086d0bf39d4ca8cb308696169282b12b42b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-12 12:10:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add configs for AMD SEV

AMD SEV requires to set several attributes to enable it:

 - launchSecurity
 - memtune with hard_limit

In addition to that, it requires to enable iommu driver for all virtio
devices, even if guest or host have no iommu device.

Add a class to create required elements and modify existing ones for SEV.

Change-Id: Ia78458ac698f66d297cb91bcab663fcf123c5442

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2019-05-17 18:31:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add <launchSecurity> element to libvirt guest XML for AMD SEV

AMD SEV requires the <launchSecurity> element in the libvirt guest XML
to enable it.  So add a LibvirtConfigGuestSEVLaunchSecurity class to
create the required element, and modify LibvirtConfigGuest to use it.

', 'number': 16}, {'created': '2019-06-20 20:39:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add <launchSecurity> and <driver iommu='on' /> to AMD SEV guest configs

<launchSecurity> enables use of SEV, so add the required config class
for it.  For now the class just describes the new element, it will be
used in further commits.

Furthermore, AMD SEV requires enabling DMA APIs for virtio devices
via <driver iommu='on' />:

  http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#proposed-change

So add the necessary bits for that to domain configuration.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ia78458ac698f66d297cb91bcab663fcf123c5442

for it.  For now the class just describes the new element, it will be
used in further commits.

Furthermore, AMD SEV requires enabling DMA APIs for virtio devices
via <driver iommu='on' />:

  http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#proposed-change

So add the necessary bits for that to domain configuration.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

commit_message:
Add <launchSecurity> and <driver iommu='on' /> to config.py

<launchSecurity> enables use of SEV, so add the required config class
for it.  For now the class just describes the new element; it will be
used in further commits.

Furthermore, AMD SEV requires enabling DMA APIs for virtio devices
via <driver iommu='on' />:

  http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#proposed-change

So also add the necessary bits for that to domain configuration.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ia78458ac698f66d297cb91bcab663fcf123c5442

subject: heat: Fix config file permissions
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-04 10:58:45.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/heat/heat.spec.j2'], 'message': 'heat: Fix config file permissions

%{groupname} is not defined in the spec.

Change-Id: If66486d4487e8c522080288b7c45d82ae98a9698
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
heat: Fix config file permissions

%{groupname} is not defined in the spec.

Change-Id: If66486d4487e8c522080288b7c45d82ae98a9698

commit_message:
Pass Domain Name to dhcp options

On subnet create dns_options are passed to OVN.
This patch adds missing domain_name field, which
is needed to support InternalDNS functionality.

Change-Id: I01e95ceb10bd6b4e0d9562c9a2abbefa85cdf1d7

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-10 18:36:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new hw:mem_encryption extra spec parameter, and a new
hw_mem_encryption image property, which indicate that any guest booted
with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively needs to
be booted with its memory hardware encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the parameter and property into a
resource request for one slot of the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT inventory
provided by Ib1304e65f1.

Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-06-11 15:45:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the parameter and property into a
resource request for one slot of the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT inventory
provided by Ib1304e65f1.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a RequestFilterFailed exception.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7
', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2019-06-17 15:13:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the
MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT inventory provided by Ib1304e65f1.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requesters() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a new generic FlavorImageConflict exception, which can also be useful
in the future for handling other similar conflicts.  In this
particular use case, FlavorImageConflict is raised by
mem_encryption_requesters(), and then caught and re-raised as a
RequestFilterFailed exception.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7

', 'number': 14}, {'created': '2019-06-20 20:39:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the inventory of
the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class (introduced in
os-resource-classes 0.4.0).  The inventory will be provided by the
follow-up commit Ib1304e65f1.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a new generic FlavorImageConflict exception, which can also be useful
in the future for handling other similar conflicts.  In this
particular use case, FlavorImageConflict is raised by
mem_encryption_requested(), and then if caught during the request
filter phase is re-raised as a RequestFilterFailed exception, or if
caught during API call validation, it's re-raised as HTTPBadRequest.

nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a new generic FlavorImageConflict exception, which can also be useful
in the future for handling other similar conflicts.  In this
particular use case, FlavorImageConflict is raised by
mem_encryption_requested(), and then if caught during the request
filter phase is re-raised as a RequestFilterFailed exception, or if
caught during API call validation, it's re-raised as HTTPBadRequest.

Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7
', 'number': 18}, {'created': '2019-07-17 09:29:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the inventory of
the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class (introduced in
os-resource-classes 0.4.0).  The inventory will be provided by the
follow-up commit I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a new generic FlavorImageConflict exception, which can also be useful
in the future for handling other similar conflicts.  In this
particular use case, FlavorImageConflict is raised by
mem_encryption_requested(), and then if caught during the request
filter phase is re-raised as a RequestFilterFailed exception, or if
caught during API call validation, it's re-raised as HTTPBadRequest.

Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7
', 'number': 33}, {'created': '2019-08-19 13:09:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the inventory of
the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class (introduced in
os-resource-classes 0.4.0).  The inventory will be provided by the
follow-up commit I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified and they contradict each other, or if either request memory
encryption but the image does not have hw_firmware_type set to UEFI,
then log an error and raise a new generic FlavorImageConflict
exception.  This exception can also be useful in the future for
handling other similar conflicts.  In this particular use case,
FlavorImageConflict is raised by mem_encryption_requested(), and then
if caught during the request filter phase is re-raised as a
RequestFilterFailed exception, or if caught during API call
validation, it's re-raised as HTTPBadRequest.

In order to test this code, we need to construct various ImageMeta
objects containing fake data and a ImageMetaProps instance for each.
This is a slightly fiddly task which future patches in the SEV series
will also need to perform, so add a helper to nova.tests.unit.image.fake
for this.

follow-up commit I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified and they contradict each other, or if either request memory
encryption but the image does not have hw_firmware_type set to UEFI,
then log an error and raise a new generic FlavorImageConflict
exception.  This exception can also be useful in the future for
handling other similar conflicts.  In this particular use case,
FlavorImageConflict is raised by mem_encryption_requested(), and then
if caught during the request filter phase is re-raised as a
RequestFilterFailed exception, or if caught during API call
validation, it's re-raised as HTTPBadRequest.

In order to test this code, we need to construct various ImageMeta
objects containing fake data and a ImageMetaProps instance for each.
This is a slightly fiddly task which future patches in the SEV series
will also need to perform, so add a helper to nova.tests.unit.image.fake
for this.

the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class (introduced in
os-resource-classes 0.4.0).  The inventory will be provided by the
follow-up commit I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified and they contradict each other, or if either request memory
encryption but the image does not have hw_firmware_type set to UEFI,
then log an error and raise a new generic FlavorImageConflict
exception.  This exception can also be useful in the future for
handling other similar conflicts.  In this particular use case,
FlavorImageConflict is raised by mem_encryption_requested(), and then
if caught during API call validation, it's re-raised as
HTTPBadRequest.

In order to test this code, we need to construct various ImageMeta
objects containing fake data and a ImageMetaProps instance for each.
This is a slightly fiddly task which future patches in the SEV series
will also need to perform, so add a helper to nova.tests.unit.image.fake
for this.

Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7

commit_message:
Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the inventory of
the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class (introduced in
os-resource-classes 0.4.0).  The inventory will be provided by the
follow-up commit I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified and they contradict each other, or if either request memory
encryption but the image does not have hw_firmware_type set to UEFI,
then log an error and raise a new generic FlavorImageConflict
exception.  This exception can also be useful in the future for
handling other similar conflicts.  In this particular use case,
FlavorImageConflict is raised by mem_encryption_requested(), and then
if caught during API call validation, it's re-raised as
HTTPBadRequest.

In order to test this code, we need to construct various ImageMeta
objects containing fake data and a ImageMetaProps instance for each.
This is a slightly fiddly task which future patches in the SEV series
will also need to perform, so add a helper to nova.tests.unit.image.fake
for this.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7

4. Convert cyborg/objects/driver_objects/driver_device.py file type from dos to
unix, to avoid ^M at the end of each line.
5. Get rid of legacy: ProviderTree class.
6. More info for driver developers:  each driver should report resource class
and traits in driver_attribute field in order that cyborg-conductor can parse
it and report to placement.
7. update deployable rp_uuid field after getting rp_uuid from placement.

Change-Id: Ib8f682255d2ae60eb615c90de0a0f7c83d1af54d
', 'number': 23}]
commit_message:
Placement report

1. Create resource provider, resource class, traits.
2. Nested resource provider is supported in this patch.
3. According to the comments and reply in:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/626057/10/cyborg/common/placement_client.py,
we should make a class to invoke Placement API. This has also been done in
this patch.
4. Convert cyborg/objects/driver_objects/driver_device.py file type from dos to
unix, to avoid ^M at the end of each line.
5. Get rid of legacy: ProviderTree class.
6. More info for driver developers:  each driver should report resource class
and traits in driver_attribute field in order that cyborg-conductor can parse
it and report to placement.
7. update deployable rp_uuid field after getting rp_uuid from placement.

Change-Id: Ib8f682255d2ae60eb615c90de0a0f7c83d1af54d

commit_message:
Add disk format content from Image Guide

The container_format and disk_format identifiers and their
descriptions are being maintained in the Glance docs.  Move some
useful content on this topic over from the Image Guide before
deleting it over there so it's only being maintained in one
location.

commit_message:
Use net_default_mac in ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic_pxe_uefi.default.j2

Upstream ironic went from $net_default_ip to $net_default_mac in
ironic/drivers/modules/master_grub_cfg.txt with
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/578959/

This commit makes the same change for
ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic_pxe_uefi.default.j2

Using $net_default_ip breaks ironic standalone deployments with
[dhcp]dhcp_provider = none

Change-Id: I2ca9a66d2bdb0aab5cd9936c8be8206e6ade3bd5
Closes-Bug: 1842078
(cherry picked from commit 870cb1beb229d6f856da4c974ca7e73d3d89d56d)

Remove pike multinode jobs

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678154/ creates the pike-eol
branch and it's time to say goodbye to pike jobs.
